resources.string: OpenVPN connection requires a user input, e.g. two factor authentification
Ongoing statistics of the established OpenVPN connection
Status changes of the OpenVPN connection (Connecting, authenticating,…)

By proceeding, you are giving the application permission to completely control OpenVPN for Android and to intercept all network traffic.Do NOT accept unless you trust the application. Otherwise, you run the risk of having your data compromised by malicious software."
Icon of app trying to use OpenVPN for Android
Waiting for user permission to use VPN API

If you did not get a VPN confirmation dialog, you have \"Always on VPN\" enabled for another app. In that case only that app is allowed to connect to a VPN. Check under Settings-> Networks more .. -> VPNS
Please enter the password for profile %s
Profile specified in shortcut not found
An external app tries to control %s. The app requesting access cannot be determined. Allowing this app grants ALL apps access.
Warning: Persistent tun not enabled for this VPN. Traffic will use the normal Internet connection when the screen is off.
Orbot application cannot be found. Please install Orbot or use manual Socks v5 integration.
Cannot use extra http-proxy-option statement and Orbot integration at the same time
OpenVPN 3 C++ implementation does not support connecting via Socks proxy
The OpenVPN 3 C++ implementation does not support static keys. Please change to OpenVPN 2.x under general settings.
Using PKCS12 files directly with OpenVPN 3 C++ implementation is not supported. Please import the pkcs12 files into the Android keystore or change to OpenVPN 2.x under general settings.
You need to define and enable at least one remote server.
Missing user certificate or user certifcate key file
Config uses option tls-remote that was deprecated in 2.3 and finally removed in 2.4
You must select a CA certificate or enable peer fingerprint check
You must select a User certificate
Answer challenge to continue VPN authentication
Open URL to continue VPN authentication
Vpn topology \"%3$s\" specified but ifconfig %s %2$s looks more like an IP address with a network mask. Assuming \"subnet\" topology.
Package %s is no longer installed, removing it from app allow/disallow list
No allowed app added. Adding ourselves (%s) to have at least one app in the allowed app list to not allow all apps
Restarting OpenVPN Service (App crashed probably crashed or killed for memory pressure)
VPN permission revoked by OS (e.g. other VPN program started), stopping VPN
No CA Certificate returned while reading from Android keystore. Authentication will probably fail.
Preferred native ABI precedence of this device (%s) and ABI reported by native libraries (%2$s) mismatch

Some versions of Android 4.1 have problems if the name of the keystore certificate contains non alphanumeric characters (like spaces, underscores or dashes). Try to reimport the certificate without special characters

Cannot access the Android Keychain Certificates. This can be caused by a firmware upgrade or by restoring a backup of the app/app settings. Please edit the VPN and reselect the certificate under basic settings to recreate the permission to access the certificate.
Reread (%d) log items from log cache file
On some custom ICS images the permission on /dev/tun might be wrong, or the tun module might be missing completely. For CM9 images try the fix ownership option under general settings
Failed to open the tun interface
Got interface information %s and %2$s, assuming second address is peer address of remote. Using /32 netmask for local IP. Mode given by OpenVPN is \"%3$s\".
Cannot make sense of %s and %2$s as IP route with CIDR netmask, using /32 as netmask.
Your image does not support the VPNService API, sorry :(
Refusing to open tun device without IP information
Error signing with Android keystore key %s: %2$s

No DNS servers being used. Name resolution may not work. Consider setting custom DNS Servers. Please also note that Android will keep using your proxy settings specified for your mobile/Wi-Fi connection when no DNS servers are set.
Could not add DNS Server \"%s\", rejected by the system: %2$s
Could not configure IP Address \"%s\", rejected by the system: %2$s
OpenVPN crashed unexpectedly. Please consider using the send Minidump option in the main menu
Pausing connection in screen off state: less than %s in %2$ss
Multiple VPNs found in your Shellfire Account. Please choose which one to use.
In case multiple VPNs are present, you don\'t have to select the VPN at each log in.
Displaying the log permanently can lead to performance loss (requires restarting the app).
Connects to the selected server. To change servers, swipe to the right.
Premium Upgrade successful. Display Server list?
Already on this server - doing nothing
Upgrade is needed. \nDo you want more information?
You are currently connected. You have to disconnect prior to the server change. Disconnect now?
Are you sure you want to change the server?
.Server is being changed. This can take a moment..
Server could not be changed. Please check the log for details.
Connection is being processed - please wait

Shellfire VPN - easy. safe. connected. No registration.
Shellfire VPN is FREE and will never cost you a dime. Unlimited Traffic, Unlimited Time!
Shellfire VPN hides your IP address, unblocks the Internet and gives you the ability to freely and anonymously access any site you want. With Shellfire VPN, you can connect to any website with the confidence knowing that you are undercover. We unblock Skype, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube etc. in countries with Internet censorship and even give you access your home country\'s TV and radio services from abroad.
Shellfire VPN gives you super strong encryption to protect your data from hackers, the NSA and other threats, even in unsecure public wifi networks!
Upgrade to Premium to get - Higher Speed. - Stronger Encryption. - Free choice from our servers in: Austria, Canada, France, Germany, Hong Kong, Italy, Netherlands, Poland, Romania, Russia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom and USA - PremiumPlus customers get exclusive access to servers in: Chile, Iceland, Isle of Man (offshore) and Liechtenstein
Shellfire VPN - the ultimate VPN client for Android.
Shellfire VPN also runs on Windows, Mac OS, iOS or Linux! Visit https://www.shellfire.net/vpn/ for more details.
For instant updates do follow us in Facebook & Twitter https://www.facebook.com/shellfire.de https://twitter.com/shellfire_en
Surf anonymously - Encrypted connection - Access Hulu, Youtube... from anywhere
%s bit encryption Upto %2$s kbit/s transfer rate Server in %3$s countries world-wide

We believe, that secure and free access to the internet is a fundamental right to every single person on this planet. That’s why, our mission is to keep the internet a place of freedom as well as a safe place for your private data. We do that by providing you with protection from eavesdroppers and hackers through our encrypted VPN tunnels and voice servers.

In recent years, we have already helped more than 500,000 users protect their privacy online and overcome censorship. Our high service and security standards \"Made in Germany\" make Shellfire one of the best addresses on the VPN market today.

Shellfire GmbH is a hosting provider based in Schmitten near Frankfurt am Main. Shellfire was founded in 2002 by Florian Gattung and Maximilian Behr, who have been acting as managing partners since that time
